system.description: This spell functions like dispel magic, except that it can end more than one spell on a target and that you can use a targeted dispel to end spells on multiple creatures or objects. You can use greater dispel magic to counterspell another spellcaster, or to dispel a spell that has been made permanent. When used to counterspell, you take a -4 penalty on the dispel check. When used to dispel a spell that has been made permanent, a successful check dispels the spell (rather than suppressing it for 1d4 rounds). You may make a dispel check (1d20 + caster level, max +20) against each ongoing spell; for each success the spell ends. For each creature or object, you make one dispel check and apply the result to all spells on that target.
system.range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level) or close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
system.target: One spellcaster, creature, or object; or 30-ft.-radius burst
